body.p: BPSS (Baseline Personnel Security Standard) is a HR pre-employment check and a requirement for all directly employed staff and contractors working within the MoJ.
Most of the IT systems within the MoJ can process OFFICIAL information and therefore, BPSS will suffice. However, some roles may require staff to have a higher level of security clearance.

Roles that include any of the below will require National Security Vetting:
Access to information classified at SECRET or TOP SECRET
Long term, regular, unsupervised access to data centres or communications rooms
Regular privileged unsupervised and unconstrained access to systems which contain data for multiple MoJ systems, for example backups, or console access to multiple cloud services
Cryptography responsibilities and handling, under advice from the Crypto Custodian
Access to multiple system security testing outcomes which reveal vulnerabilities in live services
A role such as system support or IT investigation role, such that without further authority or authorisation, an individual might:
act as another user
obtain credentials for another user
directly access other users’ data
MoJ HQ and Executive Agencies might have additional, specific requirements for DV/DV STRAP clearance for individual systems. These requirements should be followed where applicable.

There are other roles across the MoJ and its agencies where alternative clearance may also be required. Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) for information relating to children and vulnerable adults. Enhanced Level’s 1 or 2 for HMPPS roles and establishments
Please contact the NSV-Team@justice.gov.ukfor any National Security Vetting questions or further information.
